page.title: 11EDUCATION STRACATHRO
page.content: There is{one primary school}in the area,{Stracathro School.}In the first half of the 20th century, the roll was over 100, but with the building of a dual-carriageway, the A94, 3 km to the south,{transport facilities to the {town are increased}and those who live by the road or beyond it, travel to Brechin for their schooling. The{decline in the number of farm {workers due to automation and changes {in land-use,}have contributed to the fact that the{school roll is now 15, 11 boys and 4 girls. Of these, 4 live outwith Stracathro School catchment area. There is{one permanent teacher and {visiting teachers of Art, Physical {Education and Remedial Subjects.}The 3 well-appointed classrooms are equipped with{modern aids including 2 computers {colour T.V.set, and tape-recorders.
